meanings.definition: Cancel or refrain from exacting or inflicting (a debt or punishment).
meanings.sent1: She decided to remit the fine for the overdue library book.
meanings.sent2: Please remit the late fee by the end of the week.
meanings.sent3: The judge's decision to remit the penalty brought relief to the defendant.
meanings.sent4: His kindness remitted the consequences of her mistake.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's forgiveness remitted any further consequences for the student.

meanings.definition: Send (money) in payment or as a gift.
meanings.sent1: He will remit the payment for the services rendered.
meanings.sent2: Please remit the funds to the charity organization.
meanings.sent3: She decided to remit a gift to her friend for their birthday.
meanings.sent4: The company remitted the bonus to all employees for their hard work.
meanings.sent5: Remit the donation to support the cause.

meanings.sent1: Her remit includes managing the marketing campaigns.
meanings.sent2: The team discussed the remit of each member for the project.
meanings.sent3: His remit as team leader is to ensure smooth coordination.
meanings.sent4: The remit of the committee is to review company policies.
meanings.sent5: The remit of the department is to oversee customer satisfaction.
